thread.title: Magda Szubanski, Glenn Robbins: Open Slather comedians on how to stop the giggles | DailyTelegraph
thread.title_full: Magda Szubanski, Glenn Robbins: Open Slather comedians on how to stop the giggles | DailyTelegraph

author: Andrew Bucklow
title: Magda Szubanski, Glenn Robbins: Open Slather comedians on how to stop the giggles | DailyTelegraph
text:
IF YOU ever see Glenn Robbins grabbing his testicles on a TV set, he’s not being a sexual deviant ... he’s just trying to shake the giggles. You’d think that after years of recording sketches for comedy shows such as Fast Forward , Full Frontal and now Open Slather , stars such as Robbins, Magda Szubanski and Gina Riley would have learnt how to ditch the dreaded giggles once they start. But no.
Here’s what they had to say to news.com.au about what happens when they just can’t stop laughing during a scene:
The men of Kath & Kim: Peter Rowsthorn (Brett) and Glenn Robbins (Kel).
Australia’s favourite netballer, Sharon Strzelecki.
Gina Riley played Kimberly Day Craig in Kath & Kim from 2002 to 2007.
Remember when Stephen Curry played Dale Kerrigan in The Castle way back in 1997?
“There’s a smell in here that will outlast religion,” is just one of Kenny’s many classic lines.
1 of n
